turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Assistant, order a coffee for me for pickup.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Which store do you want to pickup from?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The Starbucks on Northgate Way in Seattle.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Which size coffee would you like?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Assistant, a tall, no, grande latte.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What kind of milk would you like for your latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Order soy milk.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want a hot or cold latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: A cold latte, light on the ice.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like any flavors for your latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No, well, yes. Order hazelnut flavor.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Is there anything else you would like in your latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No thank you, that's it.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like to order any other items?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Assistant, no, nothing else.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: How would you like to pay for your latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Please use my Starbucks card, there should be enough money on the Starbucks card.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I will double check your Starbucks cards' balance when I place the order.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Great idea, if there's not enough money on the card add $50 to the balance using my Mastercard.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Certainly, that is a grande iced soy latte, light on the ice, from the Starbucks on Northgate Way, payed for with your Starbucks card which I have on file.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Excellent, sounds perfect!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Your latte has been ordered at the Northgate Way Starbucks and should be ready soon. Your Starbucks card receipt will be sent to your phone as a text message.
